intro: Gilia chamissonis, commonly known as the California gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It has slender, branching stems and small, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Gilia chamissonis is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
